column1: Lumezzane (Brescian: Lœmesane; locally Lömedhane [lømeˈðane]) is a town and comune in the province of Brescia
column2: in Lombardy. With a population of 22
column3: 255 (As of 2017) it is one of the largest towns in the province of Brescia. It is situated in the Gobbia Valley
column4: which is a side valley of the Trompia Valley.

column1: The local football club of the coumne was F.C. Lumezzane V.G.Z. A.S.D.. The club was a merger of A.C. Lumezzane and another local side ValGobbiaZanano in 2018.
